title: Understanding CCPA
text: The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) is a state statute intended to enhance privacy rights and consumer protection for residents of California, USA.

hintAnswer: To enhance privacy rights and consumer protection for California residents.
title: CCPA's Purpose
text: What is the primary purpose of the CCPA?
choices: To enhance privacy rights and consumer protection for California residents.

title: Consumer Rights under CCPA
text: The CCPA provides consumers with rights such as the right to know what personal data is being collected, the right to delete personal data, and the right to opt-out of the sale of personal data.

title: True or False: CCPA Rights
text: The CCPA allows consumers to know what personal data is collected about them.
